intro: Alyssum bosniacum f. platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaved alpine alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a slightly hairy texture. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a common sight in alpine meadows and rocky outcrops.
